In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code to achieve this:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ") # Split the string into words
    wrapped_text = ""
    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width
            error("Word length exceeds the maximum width of $text_width")
        end
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) + 1 <= text_width # Check if adding a new line would exceed width
            wrapped_text *= "$word "
        else
            wrapped_text *= "\n$word "
        end
    end
    return wrapped_text
end
```

Here is an example usage:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec a diam lectus.", 15))
```
This will print:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet,
consectetur
adipiscing elit.
Donec a diam
lectus.
```
